name: carcass
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the body of a dead animal, especially a large one that is soon to be cut up as meat or eaten by wild animals: Vultures flew around in the sky waiting to pick at the rotting carcass of the deer.slang Move your great carcass (= your body) out of that chair!
the frame of an old or broken object, car, ship, etc.: Carcasses of burned-out vehicles lined the roads near the scene of the worst fighting.

the body of a dead animal: The carcass of a deer lay near the road.
